text: [Music]
i think the real reason
why formula one is such a rich hunting
ground for ai and ml
is that we are incredibly data rich as a
sport
we're dealing with so many independent
variables now that it's beyond
human capability to see all these
interactions anymore
for example i think that the aws
insights that we're now
showing on television are absolutely
great hamilton's in the lead
and then suddenly a graphic comes up
that says wow you know he's only got
three percent of his entire life left
and the race has got
seven percent left to run so i know he's
going to make a pit stop
and that is something that there's no
way without that data you are going to
be able to determine
it's a real breakthrough technology it's
an enabling technology that
allows us to understand what we need to
do to the other technologies
to push the sport forward amazon
sagemaker
is that enabler an awful lot of the
aerodynamic research that we do at the
moment is no longer done
in a wind tunnel a lot of it is done in
computational fluid dynamics
and in that we've produced about a
quarter of a petabyte
of data there's an awful lot of changes
that we make in one part of the car that
affect
the airflow and the distribution of
airflow around the car in a totally
different area
if we change a small detail in the front
wing design what does it do to the rear
wing what does it do to the diffusal
and this is one of the areas that we
we're using ml a lot now to try and
understand these interactions
so who's an actual partner to us someone
who understands every aspect of data
from
acquiring it storing it analyzing it
presenting it
that's absolutely where aws sits and why
they're
a perfect partner for us
